page.title: 14ROADS
page.content: No main roads pass through this area and the 2'B'roads linking East Meon with Langrish & the A272 joining Petersfield & Winchester & also to Hambledon & other villages to the south are confined to the north & west portions of the area.These roads are narrow,with room for only one lane of traffic in each direction.The twisting country lanes with theit high hedge- rows which criss cross the rest of the area are usually only wide enough for one vehicle.This causes problems when for instance farm machinery or hay lorries are using the roads.The village of East Meon has an additional problem:its narrow main street has double yellow lines to prevent people parking on them & causing traffic jams,yet it has no car park. This inconveniences both locals & visitors alike.
